intro: Cybistax quinquefolia, commonly known as the five-leaved stork's-bill, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive five-leafed structure at the base of the stem. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Cybistax quinquefolia is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in woodland areas.
